_comment: Do not manually edit this file, or update these source phrases in Crowdin. The source of truth for English strings are in the code source

dashboard-row.are-you-sure-you-want-to: Are you sure you want to remove this row and all its panels?

inspect.subtitle: {{queryCount}} queries with total query time of {{formatted}}
inspect.title: Inspect: {{panelTitle}}

inspect-data.download-excel-description: Adds header to CSV for use with Excel
inspect-data.formatted-data-description: Table data is formatted with options defined in the Field and Override tabs.
inspect-data.transformations-description: Table data is displayed with transformations defined in the panel Transform tab.

inspect-json.dataframe-description: Raw data without transformations and field config applied.
inspect-json.panel-data-description: The raw model passed to the panel visualization
inspect-json.panel-json-description: The model saved in the dashboard JSON that configures how everything works.

save-dashboard.a-dashboard-with-the-same-name-in-select: A dashboard with the same name in selected folder already exists.
save-dashboard.cannot-be-the-same-as-folder-name: Dashboard name cannot be the same as folder name
save-dashboard.do-you-want-to-save-your-changes: Do you want to save your changes?
save-dashboard.someone-else-has-updated-this-dashboard: Someone else has updated this dashboard
save-dashboard.title: Save dashboard
save-dashboard.would-you-still-like-to-save-this-dashbo: Would you still like to save this dashboard?
save-dashboard.your-changes-will-be-lost: Your changes will be lost when you update the plugin.

transformations-editor.it-can-help-to-switch-to-the-table: It can help to switch to the Table visualization to understand what a transformation is doing.
transformations-editor.many-transforms-are-not-suitable-if-you: Many transforms are not suitable if you're using the Graph visualization, as it currently only supports time series data.
transformations-editor.title: Transformations
transformations-editor.transformations-allow-you-to-join: Transformations allow you to join, calculate, re-order, hide, and rename your query results before they are visualized.

data-source.random-signal-within-the-selected-time-r: Random signal within the selected time range
data-source.show-directory-listings-for-public-resou: Show directory listings for public resources
data-source.this-supports-real-time-event-streams: This supports real-time event streams in Grafana core. This feature is under heavy development. Expect the interfaces and structures to change as this becomes more production ready.
data-source.using-this-datasource-to-call: Using this datasource to call the new search system is experimental, and subject to change at any time without notice.

datasource-onboarding.contact-admin: Please contact your administrator to configure data sources.
datasource-onboarding.explanation: To visualize your data, you'll need to connect it first.
datasource-onboarding.sampleData: Or set up a new dashboard with sample data

explore.choose-where-to-add-the-panel: Choose where to add the panel.
explore.select-in-which-dashboard: Select in which dashboard the panel will be created.
explore.title: Explore

unified.cannot-create-alerts-from-this-panel: Cannot create alerts from this panel because no query to an alerting capable datasource is found.
unified.dashboard-must-be-saved-before: Dashboard must be saved before alerts can be added.
unified.there-are-no-alert-rules-linked-to-this-: There are no alert rules linked to this panel.

dashboard.add-a-panel-from-the-panel-library: Add a panel from the panel library
dashboard.angular-support-disabled: Angular support disabled, legacy alerting cannot function without angular support
dashboard.annotation-queries-can-be-toggled: Annotation queries can be toggled on or off at the top of the dashboard. With this option checked this toggle will be hidden.
dashboard.color-to-use-for-the-annotation: Color to use for the annotation event markers
dashboard.do-you-want-to-delete: Do you want to delete this dashboard?

panel-editor.disconnects-this-panel-from-the-library: Disconnects this panel from the library panel so that you can edit it regularly.
panel-editor.library-panels-description: Reusable panels you can share between multiple dashboards.

panel-options.repeat-by-variable-description: Repeat this panel for each value in the selected variable. This is not visible while in edit mode. You need to go back to dashboard and then update the variable or reload the dashboard.
panel-options.title: Panel options

save-dashboard.add-a-note-to-describe-your-changes: Add a note to describe your changes
save-dashboard.save-current-time-range: Save current time range as dashboard default
save-dashboard.save-current-variable-values: Save current variable values as dashboard default

setting.alerts-are-added-and-configured: Alerts are added and configured in the Alert tab of any dashboard graph panel, letting you build and visualize an alert using existing queries.
setting.annotations-sub-title: Annotation queries return events that can be visualized as event markers in graphs across the dashboard.
setting.are-you-sure: Are you sure you'd like to proceed?
setting.are-you-sure-you-want: Are you sure you want to delete this alert rule?
setting.auto-refresh-description: Define the auto refresh intervals that should be available in the auto refresh list.
setting.controls-tooltip-and-hover: Controls tooltip and hover highlight behavior across different panels. Reload the dashboard for changes to take effect
setting.create-a-new-link: Create a new link on your dashboard
setting.dashboard-Links-allow: Dashboard Links allow you to place links to other dashboards and web sites directly below the dashboard header.
setting.edit-a-specific-link: Edit a specific link of your dashboard
setting.just-so-we-have-an-upload: DUMMY UI just so we have an upload button!
setting.name: Name
setting.panel-has-no-alert-rule-defined: Panel has no alert rule defined
setting.remember-to-save-the-dashboard: Remember to save the dashboard to persist your alert rule changes.
setting.set-to-read-only: Set to read-only to disable all editing. Reload the dashboard for changes to take effect
setting.the-JSON-model-below-is-the-data: The JSON model below is the data structure that defines the dashboard. This includes dashboard settings, panel settings, layout, queries, and so on
setting.there-are-no-dashboard: There are no dashboard links added yet
setting.this-is-an-old-visualization: This is an old visualization type that does not support searching all options.
setting.this-link-connects: This link connects to an external website at
setting.title: Title
setting.transformations-are-not-supported: Transformations are not supported in alert queries
setting.variables-sub-title: Variables can make your dashboard more dynamic and act as global filters.
setting.you-need-to-save-dashboard: You need to save dashboard for the delete to take effect.

dashboard.this-dashboard-is-managed-by-Grafana: This dashboard is managed by Grafana provisioning and cannot be deleted. Remove the dashboard from the config file to delete it.
dashboard.to-request-troubleshooting-help: To request troubleshooting help, send a snapshot of this panel to Grafana Labs Technical Support. The snapshot contains query response data and panel settings.

utils.are-you-sure-you-want-to-remove: Are you sure you want to remove this panel?
utils.panel-includes-an-alert-rule: Panel includes an alert rule. removing the panel will also remove the alert rule

dashboard.when-enabled-the-annotation-query: When enabled the annotation query is issued every dashboard refresh
dashboard.you-have-changed-a-folder: You have changed a folder, please save to view permissions.

thresholds-editor.percentage-means-thresholds: Percentage means thresholds relative to min & max

explore.the-URL-that-brought-you: The URL that brought you here was a compact URL - this format will soon be deprecated. Please replace the URL previously saved with the URL available now.
explore.variable-values-are-fetched: Variable values are fetched from a datasource query

inspector.no-request-and-response-collected-yet: No request and response collected yet. Hit refresh button
inspector.query-inspector-description: Query inspector allows you to view raw request and response. To collect this data Grafana needs to issue a new query. Click refresh button below to trigger a new query.

add-field-from-calculation.description: Use the row values to calculate a new field
add-field-from-calculation.name: Add field from calculation

config-from-query.below-the-configuration: Below the configuration listed above you will find the field table. Here all fields found in the data returned by the config query will be listed along with a **Use as** and **Select** option. This table gives you control over what field should be mapped to which config property and if there are multiple rows which value to select.
config-from-query.description: Set unit, min, max and more from data
config-from-query.each-row-in-the-source: Each row in the source data becomes a separate field. Each field now also has a maximum configuration option set. Options such as **min**, **max**, **unit**, and **thresholds** are all part of field configuration, and if they are set like this, they will be used by the visualization instead of any options that are manually configured.in the panel editor options pane.
config-from-query.name: Config from query results
config-from-query.Select-the-query-that: **Config query**: Select the query that returns the data you want to use as configuration.
config-from-query.Select-what-fields: **Apply to**: Select what fields or series to apply the configuration to.
config-from-query.this-transformation-allows: This transformation allows you select one query and from it extract standard options such as **Min**, **Max**, **Unit**, and **Thresholds** and apply them to other query results. This enables dynamic query driven visualization configuration.
config-from-query.ticos-will-build-the-value: Ticos will build the value mappings from you query result and apply it the the real data query results. You should see values being mapped and colored according to the config query results.
config-from-query.usually-a-field: **Apply to options**: Usually a field type or field name regex depending on what option you selected in **Apply to**.
config-from-query.you-can-also-transform: You can also transform a query result into value mappings. This is is a bit different because every row in the configuration query result is used to define a single value mapping row. See the following example.

convert-field-type.description: Convert a field to a specified field type
convert-field-type.name: Convert field type

transformers.create-a-single-line: Create a single line feature with a vertex at each row

editors.add-a-label-with-the-frame-name: Add a label with the frame name
editors.combine-all-fields-into-a-single-frame: Combine all fields into a single frame.  Values will be appended with undefined values if not the same length.
editors.copy-frame-name-to-field-name: Copy frame name to field name
editors.label: Label
editors.name: Name

extract-fields.description: Parse fields from content (JSON, labels, etc)
extract-fields.name: Extract fields

field-lookup.description: Use a field value to lookup additional fields from an external source.  This currently supports spatial data, but will eventually support more formats
field-lookup.name: Field lookup

filter-by-name.name: Filter by name
filter-by-name.removes-part-of-the-query-results: Removes part of the query results using a regex pattern. The pattern can be inclusive or exclusive.

filter-by-value.removes-rows-of-the-query-results: Removes rows of the query results using user-defined filters. This is useful if you can not filter your data in the data source.

filter-data-by-query.description: Filter data by query. This is useful if you are sharing the results from a different panel that has many queries and you want to only visualize a subset of that in this panel.
filter-data-by-query.name: Filter data by query

group-by.description: Group the data by a field values then process calculations for each group
group-by.name: Group by

grouping-to-matrix.description: Takes a three fields combination and produces a Matrix
grouping-to-matrix.name: Grouping to matrix

histogram.description: Calculate a histogram from input data
histogram.name: Histogram

join-by-field.description: Combine rows from two or more tables, based on a related field between them.  This can be used to outer join multiple time series on the _time_ field to show many time series in one table.
join-by-field.drop-rows-that-do: Drop rows that do not match a value in all tables
join-by-field.keep-all-rows-from: Keep all rows from any table with a value
join-by-field.name: Join by field

join-by-labels.description: Flatten labeled results into a table joined by labels
join-by-labels.name: Join by labels
join-by-labels.the-input-does-not-contain: The input does not contain any labels
join-by-labels.unable-to-join: Unable to join by the value label

labels-to-fields.description: Groups series by time and return labels or tags as fields. Useful for showing time series with labels in a table where each label key becomes a separate column
labels-to-fields.name: Labels to fields
labels-to-fields.replace-the-value: Replace the value field name with a label

limit.description: Limit the number of items displayed.
limit.name: Limit

merge.description: Merge many series/tables and return a single table where mergeable values will be combined into the same row. Useful for showing multiple series, tables or a combination of both visualized in a table.
merge.merge-has-no-effect: Merge has no effect when applied on a single frame.
merge.name: Merge

organize-fields.description: Allows the user to re-order, hide, or rename fields / columns. Useful when data source doesn't allow overrides for visualizing data.
organize-fields.name: Organize fields
organize-fields.organize-fields-only-works: Organize fields only works with a single frame. Consider applying a join transformation first.

partition-by-values.description: Splits a one-frame dataset into multiple series discriminated by unique/enum values in one or more fields.
partition-by-values.name: Partition by values

prepare-time-series.description: Will stretch data frames from the wide format into the long format. This is really helpful to be able to keep backwards compatibility for panels not supporting the new wide format.
prepare-time-series.each-frame-has-two-fields: Each frame has two fields: time, value
prepare-time-series.longInfo-description: Convert each frame to long format
prepare-time-series.multiInfo-description: Creates a new frame for each time/number pair
prepare-time-series.multiple-value-fields-of-any-type: Multiple value fields of any type
prepare-time-series.name: Prepare time series
prepare-time-series.separate-fields-rather: String values are represented as separate fields rather than as labels
prepare-time-series.string-values-are-represented: String values are represented as labels
prepare-time-series.this-takes-query: This takes query results and transforms them into a predictable time series format.
prepare-time-series.this-transformer-may: This transformer may be especially useful when using old panels that only expect the many-frame timeseries format.
prepare-time-series.wideInfo-description: Creates a single frame joined by time

reduce.collapse-each-field-into: Collapse each field into a single value
reduce.create-a-table-with-one-row: Create a table with one row for each series value
reduce.name: Reduce
reduce.reduce-all-rows-or-data-points: Reduce all rows or data points to a single value using a function like max, min, mean or last

rename-by-regex.name: Rename by regex
rename-by-regex.renames-part-of-the-query-result: Renames part of the query result by using regular expression with placeholders.

rows-to-fields.As-you-can-see-each: As you can see each row in the source data becomes a separate field. Each field now also has a max config option set. Options like **Min**, **Max**, **Unit** and **Thresholds** are all part of field configuration and if set like this will be used by the visualization instead of any options manually configured in the panel editor options pane.
rows-to-fields.description: Convert each row into a field with dynamic config
rows-to-fields.name: Rows to fields
rows-to-fields.this-transforms-rows-into: This transforms rows into separate fields. This can be useful as fields can be styled and configured individually, something rows cannot. It can also use additional fields as sources for dynamic field configuration or map them to field labels. The additional labels can then be used to define better display names for the resulting fields.

series-to-rows.description: Merge many series and return a single series with time, metric and value as columns. Useful for showing multiple time series visualized in a table.
series-to-rows.name: Series to rows

spatial-operations.apply-spatial-operations: Apply spatial operations to the geometry
spatial-operations.create-a-line-between: Create a line between two points
spatial-operations.description: Apply spatial operations to query results
spatial-operations.heading: Heading
spatial-operations.name: Spatial operations
spatial-operations.set-a-geometry: Set a geometry field based on the results of other fields
spatial-operations.use-the-geometry: Use the geometry to define a new field (heading/distance/area)

add-modal.error: Library panel with this name already exists
add-modal.folder-description: Library panel permissions are derived from the folder permissions
add-modal.name: Library panel name

admin.subtitle: Manage server-wide settings and access to resources such as organizations, users, and licenses
admin.title: Server admin

alerting.subtitle: Learn about problems in your systems moments after they occur
alerting.title: Alerting

alerting-am-routes.subtitle: Determine how alerts are routed to contact points
alerting-am-routes.title: Notification policies

alerting-groups.subtitle: See grouped alerts from an Alertmanager instance
alerting-groups.title: Groups

alerting-list.subtitle: Rules that determine whether an alert will fire
alerting-list.title: Alert rules

alerting-receivers.subtitle: Decide how your contacts are notified when an alert fires
alerting-receivers.title: Contact points

alerting-silences.subtitle: Stop notifications from one or more alerting rules
alerting-silences.title: Silences

api-keys.subtitle: Manage and create API keys that are used to interact with Grafana HTTP APIs
api-keys.title: API keys

apps.subtitle: App plugins that extend the Grafana experience
apps.title: Apps

dashboards.subtitle: Create and manage dashboards to visualize your data
dashboards.title: Dashboards

global-orgs.subtitle: Isolated instances of Grafana running on the same server
global-orgs.title: Organizations

library-panels.subtitle: Reusable panels that can be added to multiple dashboards
library-panels.title: Library panels

playlists.subtitle: Groups of dashboards that are displayed in a sequence
playlists.title: Playlists

plugins.subtitle: Extend the Grafana experience with plugins
plugins.title: Plugins

server-settings.subtitle: View the settings defined in your Grafana config
server-settings.title: Settings

service-accounts.subtitle: Use service accounts to run automated workloads in Grafana
service-accounts.title: Service accounts

snapshots.subtitle: Interactive, publically available, point-in-time representations of dashboards
snapshots.title: Snapshots

starred-empty.title: Your starred dashboards will appear here

teams.subtitle: Groups of users that have common dashboard and permission needs
teams.title: Teams

users.subtitle: Invite and assign roles to users
users.title: Users

kiosk.tv-alert: Press ESC to exit kiosk mode

dashboard.this-dashboard-does-not-have-any-other-p: This dashboard does not have any other panels. Add queries to other panels and try again.

aria-label.choose-interval: Auto refresh turned off. Choose refresh time interval
aria-label.duration-selected: Choose refresh time interval with current interval {{durationAriaLabel}} selected

embed.html-description: The HTML code below can be pasted and included in another web page. Unless anonymous access is enabled, the user viewing that page need to be signed into Grafana for the graph to load.
embed.info: Generate HTML for embedding an iframe with this panel.
embed.time-range-description: Transforms the current relative time range to an absolute time range

link.info-text: Create a direct link to this dashboard or panel, customized with the options below.
link.render-instructions: To render a panel image, you must install the <1>Grafana image renderer plugin</1>. Please contact your Grafana administrator to install the plugin.
link.save-dashboard: To render a panel image, you must save the dashboard first.
link.time-range-description: Transforms the current relative time range to an absolute time range

snapshot.deleted-message: The snapshot has been deleted. If you have already accessed it once, then it might take up to an hour before before it is removed from browser caches or CDN caches.
snapshot.info-text-1: A snapshot is an instant way to share an interactive dashboard publicly. When created, we strip sensitive data like queries (metric, template, and annotation) and panel links, leaving only the visible metric data and series names embedded in your dashboard.
snapshot.info-text-2: Keep in mind, your snapshot <1>can be viewed by anyone</1> that has the link and can access the URL. Share wisely.
snapshot.name: Snapshot name
snapshot.timeout-description: You might need to configure the timeout value if it takes a long time to collect your dashboard metrics.

content.empty-recent-list: <0><0>It looks like you haven't used this time picker before. As soon as you enter some time intervals, recently used intervals will appear here.</0></0><1><0>Read the documentation</0><1> to find out more about how to enter custom time ranges.</1></1>

range-content.default-error: Please enter a past date or "now"
